newsitem.title: NORWAY: Norwegian central bank says will still intevene.
newsitem.headline: Norwegian central bank says will still intevene.

text.p: Norway's central bank said on Thursday it would still continue to intervene on the foreign exchange market in order to maintain a stable currency.
A bank spokesman was responding to money market rumours that it had abandoned intervention following the recent strengthening of the Norwegian crown.
The currency on Thursday tested its highest level against the mark since January 1993 at 4.2110/20.

"We are still intervening (on the foreign exchange market)," said Leif Eide, director of the bank's market operations department. "There is no free float of the Norwegian crown. But our strategy may change from time to time."
